DOC.brief_summary: Historically , vitamin D consider play role solely bone calcium metabolism . Numerous study suggest link vitamin D deficiency adverse health outcome malignancy , cardiovascular disease , immune functioning , glucose metabolism . In obstetrics literature , vitamin D deficiency link preeclampsia , gestational diabetes , increase rate cesarean section rate . Recent data retrospective chart review demonstrate possible role vitamin D implantation clinical pregnancy rate patient undergoing in-vitro fertilization . Patients find deficient vitamin D find significantly low clinical pregnancy rate compare patient replete vitamin D level . Currently , prospective clinical trial investigate effect vitamin D supplementation IVF outcomes clinical pregnancy rate implantation rate . The investigator hypothesize vitamin D supplementation patient find either deficient insufficient vitamin D lead improve pregnancy rate infertility patient undergo in-vitro fertilization .
